thread.title: Angry Genoa fans block team bus from leaving airport following 5-0 Pescara thrashing
thread.title_full: Angry Genoa fans block team bus from leaving airport following 5-0 Pescara thrashing - Mirror Online

author: mirror.co.uk
title: Angry Genoa fans block team bus from leaving airport following 5-0 Pescara thrashing
text:
Angry Genoa fans block team bus from leaving airport following 5-0 Pescara thrashing Head coach Ivan Juric was sacked shortly after the damning loss Share Comments By Thomas Bristow 11:02, 22 FEB 2017 Updated 11:05, 22 FEB 2017 Sport Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Watch this video again Video will play in Genoa fans block in team bus in protest after 5-0 defeat Share this video Watch Next football More than 100 angry Genoa fans greeted their side's team bus on Sunday following the club's damning loss to Pescara.
The Griffins were thrashed 5-0 by the club bottom of Serie A , giving Pescara only their second win of the season.
The latest defeat means Genoa have now gone 10 games with victory, losing eight on the way.
And understandably, the northern Italian side's fans had had enough.
Which is why supporters of the club met their players back home in Genoa after they landed at the airport.
Genoa fans stand strong (Photo: Gianluca Di Marzio / Youtube) Police are forced to create a way through (Photo: Gianluca Di Marzio / Youtube) Roughly 100 supporters blocked the team bus's path, making the club's players and staff unable to leave the airport. Clearly the fans weren't too keen on letting them back into the city.
Police eventually created a path for the coach to get through.
Shortly after the game, head coach Ivan Juric was dismissed from his job, with Andrea Mandorlini taking his place.
